WorkItem.Description:
Please refer to attached profile.
For feet, some shoes worth minus value. Does this mean that they are worse than nothing?
And which is interesting that, this minus happens with some certain and weird condition. For example, when "options-sustained fight-number of maintained rejuvenations" is 5, many minus value. When it was set to 4 or 6, all seemed correct.

Comments.Message: I'll take a look after the weekend.

I think I found the direct reason.
If I do not "Ignore haste from Nature's Grace when calculating Combat Stats" from Special effects. Then other options would make item values less than 0.
If I do, then it seems like not options would make them minus.

Observations:
Using the attached .xml, but removing the feet:

Stats/Base Stats/Base Spell Haste: 25.63%
Stats/Combat Stats/Spell Haste: 50.75%

The change corresponds to 100% Nature's Grace uptime (1.2563*1.2 = 1.5076).

Equip Boots of the Frozen Seed (76 Haste, 46 crit) and both those Haste numbers go to 28.18%.

100% NG uptime is too optimistic, and 0% is too pessimistic.  I did a very small amount of looking at the code (not in a debugger) and didn't see any obvious mistakes.
